plugins.name: Table Generator
plugins.description:
Instantly generate responsive tables with mock data to fit your design requirements.


Read Documentation | Watch Demo


Plugin Settings:

No. of Rows - Total number of rows required in the table.

Cell Width - Width of each cell in the table.

Cell Padding - Padding applied to each cell in the table.

Cell Alignment - Text alignment within each cell.

Striped Table - Option to enable zebra striping for the table.


Supported Data Types:


Blank Cell - Generates an empty cell.


Serial Number - Generates sequential numbers.

Ex: 1, 2, 3, ...


Name - Generates full names, providing options for first names, last names, and variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: Alice Adams, Benjamin Brown, ...


Email - Generates email addresses with an option to provide custom domain names and variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: alice.adams@example.com, benjamin.brown@somedomain.com, ...


List - Generates items from a list with variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: Apple, Samsung, Google, ...


Date - Generates dates (randomized) with an option to pass custom year or year range (ex: 2004, 2004-2022) can be

Ex: 2024-06-22, 2024-Jun-22, ...


Date format tokens:

YYYY - Full year (e.g., 2024)

YY - Short year (e.g., 24)

MMM - Short month name (e.g., Jan)

MM - Month (e.g., 01 to 12)

DD - Day (e.g., 01 to 31)


Time - Generates times, randomized.

Ex: 13:45, 08:30 PM, ...


Time format tokens:

HH - Hours in 24-hour format (00 to 23)

hh - Hours in 12-hour format (01 to 12)

mm - Minutes (00 to 59)

ss - Seconds (00 to 59)

SSS - Milliseconds (000 to 999)

A - Period (AM or PM)


Timestamp - Generates timestamps, randomized.

Ex: 2024 Jun 21 08:39:16 AM, ...


Timestamp format tokens:

YYYY - Full year (e.g., 2024)

YY - Short year (e.g., 24)

MMM - Short month name (e.g., Jan)

MM - Month (e.g., 01 to 12)

DD - Day (e.g., 01 to 31)

HH - Hours in 24-hour format (00 to 23)

hh - Hours in 12-hour format (01 to 12)

mm - Minutes (00 to 59)

ss - Seconds (00 to 59)

SSS - Milliseconds (000 to 999)

A - Period (AM or PM)


Phone - Generates randomized phone numbers with customizable options including country code, phone number length, and starting digits.

Ex: +44 XXXXXXXXXX, ...


Number - Generates random numbers with options to specify maximum length and number range.

Ex: 1234566, 2344, ...


Price - Generates random prices within a specified range, allowing customization of currency prefix or suffix.

Ex: $ 200.00, 200.00 $, ...

accepted.name: Ismail Vittal
accepted.description: Product leader, developer & design specialist with a passion for creative technology, innovation and mentorship.

plugins.tagline: Effortlessly generate tables with mock data.

plugins.name: Tokenify -  Replace Colors with Tokens
plugins.description:
It automates the process of replacing colors in your designs with pre-defined color tokens. Whether you're working with frames, shapes, or text, this plugin ensures consistency across your design by utilizing color tokens from your selected collections.


How It Works


Fetch Token Collections 📦:

The plugin fetches all local variable collections (tokens) available in the Figma file and presents them in a dropdown for selection.


Recursive Token Resolution 🔍:

The plugin resolves token values recursively, ensuring that even nested or aliased tokens are accurately identified and utilized.


Scoping and Application 🎯:

Tokens can be scoped to specific properties such as FRAME_FILL, SHAPE_FILL, TEXT_FILL, STROKE_COLOR. The plugin respects these scopes, applying tokens only to appropriate elements.

Users can specify which properties (fills, strokes) should be considered for replacement via checkboxes.


Processing Nodes 🌐:

The plugin traverses all selected nodes, including those nested within frames and groups, ensuring comprehensive coverage.

For each node, it determines the type (frame, shape, text) and checks if the fill, stroke, or effect colors match any tokens in the selected collection.


Replacement with Tokens 🔄:

If a match is found, the corresponding color in the node is replaced with the token, ensuring that the design stays consistent with the defined color system.


Features


Ease of Use 🛠️:

Simple UI to select token collections and specify scoping preferences.

Automatically fetches and displays all local variable collections in the Figma file.


Comprehensive Coverage 🖌️:

Supports fills, strokes, and effects.

Processes all nodes within selected frames and groups.


Precision 🎨:

Respects token scopes to apply them only to relevant properties.

Recursively resolves token values to ensure accuracy.


How to Use


Select Nodes:

Select the frames, shapes, or text nodes you want to update in your Figma file.


Run the Plugin:

Open the plugin from the Figma Plugins menu.

Select the desired token collection from the dropdown.


Set Preferences:

Choose which properties to update (fills, strokes) using the checkboxes.


Replace Colors:

Click the "Replace Colors" button. The plugin will traverse the selected nodes, resolve token values, and update the colors based on the selected preferences


Example Use Cases


Consistent Theming 🌈:

Ensure all elements in your design adhere to a consistent color theme by replacing arbitrary HEX values with predefined tokens.

Design System Integration 🖼️:


Seamlessly integrate your designs with a design system that uses tokens for color management.


Quick Updates ⚡:

Easily update the color scheme across multiple elements without manually changing each one.


Get Started


Install the Plugin:

Load the plugin into Figma by following the standard plugin installation steps.


Run and Enjoy:

Simplify your color management process and maintain design consistency with ease!


Happy designing! 🎨✨
plugins.tagline: Replace color styles, tokens and any color values for fill(s) and border(s) with tokens

plugins.name: iOS 日本語システムフォント サイズ計算
plugins.description:
iOSでシステムフォントを指定して日本語のテキストラベルを表示した場合、実際に指定したフォントサイズよりも小さく表示されます。

この課題に関する詳しい話は記事にも書いています。

iOSアプリのシステムフォントにおける日本語のフォントサイズとのギャップを減らす工夫


Figmaではこのようなシステムフォントを再現することができないため、Figmaで作成したテキストラベルと同じ大きさの日本語テキストラベルを表示するためのサイズを計算し、レイヤー名に追加します。


エンジニアはテキストのレイヤー名に表示されるフォントサイズを実装時に指定することで、同じ文字サイズを表示することができます。


使い方

  • 適用したいテキストオブジェクトを選択状態にします（グループを選択したり、複数選択した場合は、選択したすべてのテキストオブジェクトに適用されます）
  • iOS ja system font sizeプラグインのInteger/Floatをメニューから実行します
  • Integerは小数点以下を四捨五入し、整数で表示します
  • Floatは小数点第二位以下を四捨五入し、小数も含めて表示します（より正確にしたい場合にお使いください）
  • レイヤー名の先頭に*が入っている場合は、Figmaで指定した通りのフォントサイズを追加します（アルファベットや数字のみで表示される箇所など、実際の指定通りのサイズのままにしておきたい箇所にお使いください）


GitHub: https://github.com/kudakurage/figma-ios-ja-font-size

accepted.name: Kaz Motoyama @kudakurage
accepted.description: Product Manager / Designer at Puddle Sketch. Spinners Inc. co-founder.

plugins.name: Velocity: AI user testing for prototypes
plugins.description:
Prompt AI on prototypes BEFORE sharing as human tasks.

Generate heat-mapped reports to justify your earliest designs with AI drop off, miss clicks and duration.


Test prototypes with AI prompts then… try on humans

  1. Example: Delete event from Apple Calendar
  2. Example: Onboarding Demos: Spotify & Netflix


All features:

  1. Prompt AI user testing on your earliest prototypes & wireframes
  2. Build confidence running 100s of simulations
  3. Learn by querying AI behaviour after simulations
  4. Understand activity with AI and human Click-maps / heat-maps
  5. Gather human feedback with user test questions
  6. Password protect tests
  7. Review your designs for WCAG accessibility
  8. Share web reports of success rate, time-on-task, miss-clicks, drop off


 ...all native within Figma

Because we know the pain of user testing - no time, budget, or feedback. Always review first with simulated participants!

Built by a designer, PM, and engineer who've all been there.

appvelocity.io & Direct help on Discord
plugins.tagline: AI test prompt prototypes BEFORE sharing as human tasks w/ heat-maps

plugins.name: Text to CSV to Text
plugins.description:
"Text to CSV to Text" for Figma is your essential tool for seamless text collaboration and content management within the Figma design environment. This powerful, free plugin empowers designers and stakeholders to work together effortlessly, whether it's for translation, content updates, or content generation, all powered by CSV integration.


Key Features:


  1. Export and Import with CSV: Select any text node, component, frame, or page within your Figma project and export it to a CSV file with a single click. Modify the content externally, and then effortlessly import the CSV to update your Figma design with the latest text revisions.
  2. Mixed Style Support: Preserve the integrity of your designs with support for mixed text styles. Whether it's a combination of fonts, sizes, or colors, our plugin retains the original text styling during export and import.
  3. Localization Made Easy: Simplify the localization process by exporting text for translation. Collaborate with your localization team by providing them with the CSV file, and then import the translated content back into your Figma design seamlessly.
  4. Content Collaboration: Engage with your marketing, content, and copywriting teams more effectively. Request content updates directly through the CSV, enabling non-design stakeholders to contribute directly to your design project.
  5. Local and Secure: Rest easy knowing that your data is never sent to external servers. Our plugin operates locally, ensuring the security and privacy of your design assets.
  6. User-Friendly: With an intuitive interface, this plugin is designed to be user-friendly for both designers and non-designers alike. Easily export and import text content without any technical expertise.


Unlock the true potential of collaborative design and streamline your content management workflow with CSV Text Manager for Figma. Start collaborating efficiently, for free, and enhance your Figma design projects with the power of CSV integration.


Support Us: If you're loving this plugin and want to contribute to its continued development, consider buying us a virtual coffee ☕. Every sip fuels our commitment to enhancing your design journey.

Get started now: buymeacoffee.com/sunnyladkani

accepted.name: Sunny
accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.tagline: Export Text elements to CSV, change text and import back to update Figma.

plugins.name: code-transformer
plugins.description:
This is Proof of Concept of generating code from Figma using OpenAI API.

The plugin converts your Figma design into JSON format and call OpenAI API to generate code.


For the best outcome, structure your design


  • No Group, Just use Frame
  • Use Auto Layout as possible
  • define naming rule for Components and Variant properties
  • Use Style or/and TokenStudio
  • Structure layer like code
  • Name layers appropriately


This project is OSS and if you want to contribute or develop your own, please visit the repository below

https://github.com/kazuyaseki/figma-code-transformer

accepted.name: Kazuya Seki
accepted.description: frontend dev. React, TS, Figma lover

plugins.tagline: Transforms your Figma design into code powered by OpenAI API

54241.name: code-transformer
54241.description:
This is Proof of Concept of generating code from Figma using OpenAI API.

The plugin converts your Figma design into JSON format and call OpenAI API to generate code.


For the best outcome, structure your design


  • No Group, Just use Frame
  • Use Auto Layout as possible
  • define naming rule for Components and Variant properties
  • Use Style or/and TokenStudio
  • Structure layer like code
  • Name layers appropriately


This project is OSS and if you want to contribute or develop your own, please visit the repository below

https://github.com/kazuyaseki/figma-code-transformer
54241.tagline: Transforms your Figma design into code powered by OpenAI API

plugins.name: PDF Fusion
plugins.description:
// Only works on Desktop app and not on browser. //


This plugin is designed to streamline the process of exporting multi-page PDFs directly from Figma. It offers a seamless solution for designers looking to manage document exports efficiently with advanced features like:


Multi-Page PDF Export

Easily export selected frames as a single, multi-page PDF without leaving Figma.


File Compression

Optimize your PDF file size with built-in compression options, ensuring that your exports are lightweight without sacrificing quality.

Custom Page Reordering: Drag and drop to reorder pages before export, giving you complete control over the sequence of your final document.


User-Friendly Interface

The intuitive UI makes it easy to select frames, adjust the export settings, and generate the final PDF in just a few clicks.


Perfect for designers who frequently work with multi-frame designs and need flexibility in exporting PDF files with precision and efficiency.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export multi-page PDFs with compression and custom page order in Figma.

117268.name: PDF Fusion
117268.description:
// Only works on Desktop app and not on browser. //

File Compression

Custom Page Reordering: Drag and drop to reorder pages before export, giving you complete control over the sequence of your final document.


User-Friendly Interface

The intuitive UI makes it easy to select frames, adjust the export settings, and generate the final PDF in just a few clicks.


Perfect for designers who frequently work with multi-frame designs and need flexibility in exporting PDF files with precision and efficiency.
117268.release_notes:
The selection list now displays frames with the newest selection at the bottom, reversing the previous behavior that caused confusion. This ensures a more intuitive experience when organizing selected frames.

The draggable feature now operates smoothly, making it easier to reorder frames.

Added visual cues for drop zones, providing clarity on where a frame will be placed.

Introduced "Explicitly Moved" badges to indicate frames you intentionally reordered.

Added "Moved" badges for frames whose positions were indirectly adjusted due to your reordering actions. These badges help users easily track changes in the selection order.
117268.tagline: Effortlessly export multi-page PDFs with compression and custom page order in Figma.

plugins.name: Airfig
plugins.description:
Airfig lets you flow content from Airtable into your Figma designs.


Introducing Airfig - the must-have plugin for seamlessly integrating your Airtable content into your Figma designs!


With Airfig, you can effortlessly map Airtable fields to Figma layers by giving them the same name or using our manual mapping feature. This feature helps you spend less time tinkering with data and more time crafting beautiful designs.


Airfig makes it easy to populate your Figma designs with content from Airtable, whether you want to create tables or tiled layouts of cards with different records from your Airtable. And when your content changes, updating your design is as simple as clicking a button.


What’s more, Airfig allows you to improve your design workflow by allowing others to manage the content while you focus on the design itself. This powerful feature ensures that your designs are always up-to-date with the latest content from your Airtable.


With Airfig, you can take your Figma designs to the next level, creating beautiful, professional-quality work with ease!
plugins.tagline: The Airtable to Figma Layout Tool

plugins.name: Style Quick Actions
plugins.description:
Style Quick Actions - Figma Plugin

Quick actions for applying styles to selected including Text, Fill, Stroke, Effect, and Grid. Works with local styles and published Team Library styles. Also works with Color Variables.


Local styles will always be available options, no management necessary. To learn how to access styles from other files, read 'Using Published Figma Team Library Styles' below.


Recommended Use


Quick Key Combos

To quickly select the commands from the quick actions input, type:

  1. qfl for Fill
  2. qsk for Stroke
  3. qtx for Text
  4. qgd for Grid
  5. qef for Effect


For example, to set a Fill quickly, type: ⌘/ > qfl > pri-blu-1 to match 'primary-blue-fill-01'


Key Bindings

You can set custom keybindings on MacOS that will automatically open one of the style fills. This is probably possible on Windows too, but I don't know the details.

  1. Navigate to: System Preferences > Keyboard > Shortcuts > App Shortcuts > click "+"
  2. Select Application: "Figma.app" and set shortcut for plugin commands by pasting in the "Menu Title" in this format: Plugins->Plugin Name->Plugin Command


I prefer to set the actions for setting Fill, Stroke, and Text to:

  1. ⌃F - Fill - Plugins->Style Quick Actions->Fill
  2. ⌃S - Stroke - Plugins->Style Quick Actions->Stroke
  3. ⌃T - Text - Plugins->Style Quick Actions->Text


Read more on Apple Support


Using Published Figma Team Library Styles


To use Team Library Styles in another file

  1. Publish your file as a Figma 'Team Library'
  2. Publish your file by running 'Style Quick Actions > Publish Library Styles'
  3. In the another file, run 'Style Quick Actions > Toggle Library Styles' and select the library
  4. The Styles will now be available in the Fill, Stroke, Text, Effect, and Grid Style selectors


You will have to update Published Styles every time the Team Library Styles are updated.

  1. Update Published Styles by running 'Style Quick Actions > Publish Library Styles' again.


Delete styles by running 'Style Quick Actions > Remove Library Styles'


Caveats:

  1. Library Styles are saved in this plugin based on their source file name. If that file name changes, the plugin will treat it as a new Published Library Style. If you change the a source file name, delete the old one and re-publish.
  2. There is a max memory limit of 1MB for each plugin. This means there is a limited number of styles you can publish via this plugin. There is a percentage % next to the Published Style name that displays how much of the total memory each Library takes up.
  3. You can't Toggle Published Styles in their own source library. Those styles are always available locally.


GitHub Repo
plugins.tagline: Apply Text Styles, Color Styles, and Color Variables using Quick Actions

plugins.name: Review Raven (AI design review partner)
plugins.description:
Review Raven is an AI review partner that can automatically analyse your Figma design screens such (websites, landing pages, email templates, UI/UX screens, social media posts) and provide you with quality feedback and design reviews with seconds so that you can design smarter and ship faster.


Feedback within seconds!⏱️

Simply choose your screens for review, choose the description (design brief) frame, and run the plugin. You will get a detailed review within seconds.


Quality insights!🎖️

Get quality, actionable feedback points so that you know exactly what to do next. The areas that the AI reviews are text, copy, call-to-action, design and copy hierarchy, overall layout, guidelines (if any) and UI.


AI-driven suggestions! ⭐

crafted by the innovators at Blursday, who are experts in user behavior, branding, and AI. Our seasoned team has a strong track record of delivering solutions for Sequoia and YC-backed startups like CRED, Unacademy, and Walrus/Defy (Y-Combinator '21). Review Raven is not just a tool; it's a learning AI that evolves with each use, continually enhancing your experience with smarter, more intuitive interactions.


Check out more about us at blursday.wtf

plugins.name: Figma to Demo
plugins.description:
Folio is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of converting design file from a Figma canvas into a structured sequence of steps for creating demonstrations. We created this innovative tool as an extension to Folio that enhances your Figma workflow efficiency by automating the tedious task of manual step-by-step documentation for video tutorials, user guides, walkthroughs, and more.


Features

Image Sequence Import: Seamlessly import a sequence of images directly from your Figma canvas into the plugin. This eliminates the need to export images manually and ensures a smooth transition from design to video documentation.

Step Arrangement: The plugin intelligently organizes the imported images into a logical sequence, creating a smooth flow for your video demo. This saves you valuable time in arranging and rearranging steps manually.

Customizable Captions: While the plugin generates default step descriptions, you retain full control over the content inside the folio.la editor. You can easily edit and customize step captions to ensure they perfectly match the narrative of your video demo.

Timing and Transitions: Define each step's duration in the video and specify transitions between steps. This ensures that your video demonstration maintains a smooth and engaging pace.

Export & Embed Options: Once the steps are generated and refined, you can export or embed the sequence as a detailed storyboard or script. This flexibility allows you to work with a variety of video editing software.

Collaboration-Friendly: Collaborate seamlessly with team members. Share your generated steps, storyboard, or script with your production team for further enhancement and implementation.

Time-Saving Efficiency: The plugin significantly reduces the time and effort required to create informative and engaging video tutorials by automating the process of generating step-by-step video documentation.

Enhanced Communication: The plugin bridges the gap between design and documentation teams. Clear and concise video demo steps make it easier for teams to communicate complex processes and interactions.

Regular Updates: The plugin is built with growth in mind. Expect regular updates that add new features, enhance performance, and improve usability based on user feedback.

accepted.name: Folio Demo
accepted.description: An affordable & versatile demo creation platform, suitable for teams of all sizes. We're committed to building a GTM enablement platform.

plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma design file into an interactive demo

plugins.name: Speedboat
plugins.description:
Build Tailwind designs and convert them to code with speed! Speedboat helps you by building a panel from your Tailwind configuration. No more quesswork!


Features

Style Library

Opens a panel which will allow you to design using the values from your configuration. Here you can pick your dimensions, fills, shadows and more with just a few clicks. It also offers a handy Copy class names button so you can design and prototype quicker than ever before. 🤯


Copy class names

Copies the selected layer Tailwind-compatible class names for supported properties based on your configuration to your clipboard. If your configuration specifies eg. "brand-blue" colour and your design uses that colour as a Fill, the result copied to your clipboard will be "bg-brand-blue".


Settings

Opens a panel with Speedboat configuration. This panel will allow you to set the base font size for your design (if you use relative units) and import your own Tailwind configuration. The configuration is embedded into the file, so you can share it and don’t have to wory about also having to share the configuration.


Supported properties

  • Dimensions
  • Opacity
  • Corner radius
  • Solid fill
  • Gradient fill (soon)
  • Stroke
  • Shadow
  • Font size
  • Line height
  • Letter spacing
  • Text decoration
  • Text transform
  • Text align
  • Font weight (soon)


Note

Speedboat is a paid plugin. Head to https://speedboat.sh to get your activation code!


FAQ

https://speedboat.sh/faq

plugins.name: Composer
plugins.description:
Mail-merge type of plugin. Generate personalized PDFs with Google Sheets


### Note / How-to Use

- Make sure to generate your own Google Sheets-scoped API key so you can access your Google Sheet file

- Make sure your Google Sheet file is visible to anyone with the link (not limited to people added)

- Headers will always be on the first row

 - They can only be alphanumeric, with dashes, and underscores

- Make sure a frame layer is selected

- Make sure to insert `%%{header name}%%`on your text, the plugin will loop over the text layers under the selected frame

- Only Text layer is supported at the moment


### If you're having problems or want something to be better feel free to open an issue!

plugins.name: Clipboard: Copy/Paste Properties Plus Plus
plugins.description:
Clipboard is the Clipy for Figma.


  • Run the plugin and Select a node in the file
  • Copy Properties to Clipboard.
  • Paste them later anywhere in that file or a different one.
  • Double tap on properties to see details
  • Tap on settings to Remove or Rename
  • Filter node properties
  • Setting to see only file properties or all


  • Multi-Property Clipboard: Clipboard allows designers to copy and manage multiple node properties, breaking the limitations of single-node copying and pasting.
  • Cross-File Functionality: Seamlessly transfer node properties between different Figma files, enhancing your design workflow across projects.
  • Effortless Property Selection: Filter and organize the copied properties based on node types, making it easy to apply the right styles and elements to your design.
  • Reset Clipboard: Need a fresh start? Clipboard offers a quick and simple way to reset your clipboard, ensuring a clean slate for your next design task.

plugins.name: Figma to Droip (WordPress)
plugins.description:
Elevate your design process with the Figma-to-Droip plugin, a powerful collaboration tool that seamlessly transforms your static designs into fully functional websites.


How it works:

  1. Installation: Begin by installing the Figma-to-Droip plugin from the Resources tab in Figma.
  2. Copy + paste: For best results, create with auto layout in Figma then copy your design into Driop (command + v).
  3. Edit + Launch: Bring your designs to life within the Droip platform, utilizing its extensive features and capabilities. Fine-tune your website's elements, add interactivity, and with ease, launch your website to the world.


Naming Guidelines:

For the following element types, use these specific built-in element names in Figma for easy identification during import.


  1. Button: Button, button, BUTTON
  2. Form: Form, form, FORM
  3. Input: Input, input, INPUT
  4. Textarea: Textarea, textarea, TEXTAREA
  5. Link: Link, link, LINK
  6. Section: Section, section, SECTION
  7. Container: Container, container, CONTAINER


Additional Features:

  1. Seamless transfer of design components and styling from Figma to Droip.
  2. Access to Droip's comprehensive set of features and tools for website development.
  3. Effortlessly maintain design consistency and efficiency throughout the design-to-development process.
plugins.tagline: Transform your design from Figma to Droip

plugins.name: File Optimizer
plugins.description:
The File Optimizer plugin is a specialized tool to enhance the performance and organization of Figma files. This plugin is designed to streamline the file optimization process, ensuring your Figma documents are performance-optimized. Here's how File Optimizer can improve your Figma files:


Ungroup single-layer groups: This feature ungroups any group or groups of frames containing only one layer. It's ideal for reducing unnecessary group layers, simplifying your document structure and enhancing file performance.

Pixel-perfect alignment: By aligning all layers to the nearest pixel, this function eliminates blurry edges and ensures sharp, clear visuals. This is critical for maintaining high-quality graphics and improving the visual clarity of your designs.

Remove hidden layers: This tool removes all hidden layers from your document. This action not only declutters your file but also lightens the load on Figma's rendering engine, leading to better performance, especially in complex files.

Control Shadows: This feature streamlines the management of shadow effects in your Figma files. Hiding shadows can significantly reduce rendering load, especially in complex documents, leading to smoother interactions and faster load times.


If you are managing large-scale Figma files, this plugin ensures your documents are optimized for peak performance, making your design process smoother and more efficient.
plugins.tagline: Optimize with ease: clean, align, reveal

plugins.name: SVG to Vue.js component
plugins.description:
Convert selected frames to .vue files with common props. Best for icons, logos and illustrations.


How to use

  1. Select frames
  2. Run plugin
  3. Customize export options
  4. Click «Download»
  5. Copy files to your project
  6. Use in your project <FrameName size="24px" style="color: black" />


Component props

size: String optional

width: String optional

height: String optional

<FrameIcon size="24px" />

<FrameIcon width="24px" />

<FrameIcon height="24px" />


Export options

‘.fill-current-color’ instead of grayscale fill

‘.stroke-current-color’ instead of grayscale stroke

Removes grayscale fill/stroke and adds class to the node. Only works if all fills/strokes in the frame are grayscale (if frame has a saturated fill/stroke color the entire frame will be ignored). Best for icons. Don't forget add css rules:

.fill-current-color { fill: currentColor }

.stroke-current-color { stroke: currentColor }


Remove masks

Removes all <mask> nodes


Remove frame clipPath

Sets overflow="visible" and removes clip-path. Useful when you want to keep the size of the frame, but there are elements that go beyond its borders. For example elements with a shadow


Github

plugins.name: Find & Replace Words - Frames & Sections
plugins.description:
Hey designers! Tired of hunting down text in your Figma projects? We've got you covered with our new plugin that makes finding and replacing text a breeze.


Here's how it works:


  1. Pick the frames or sections you want to search through.
  2. Type in what you're looking for.
  3. Want it to be case-sensitive? Just tick the box.
  4. Hit "Find text" and watch it go to work.
  5. Boom! It'll show you how many matches it found
  6. Need to swap out some text? No problem - our replace feature has your back.


Whether you're knee-deep in a massive project or just need to make a quick tweak, this plugin's got you. It's all about making your life easier and your workflow smoother. Give it a shot and see how much time you can save!

plugins.name: FeedLabs
plugins.description:
The FeedLabs plugin helps you to quickly turn spreadsheets/csv files/feeds into beautiful creatives. Check out https://feedlabs.io for more!


How to

1) Create a template (frame), using Figma

2) Upload a CSV file with your items, using the plugin

3) Render the frame for all items in a few seconds


Features

  • Dynamic images; use image URLs to show a different image per item
  • Dynamic text; use fields inside text elements to show different text per item. (e.g. ${{price}},-)
  • Conditional rendering; show an element depending on a certain condition (e.g. 'sale' EQUAL true)
  • Render up to 50 items in a few seconds
  • Make infinite templates and designs, using Figma


FAQ

What is the pricing model?

The plugin in the current state will always be available for free.


What if I want to add more than 50 items?

This plugin is a free service and only allows limited features. However, we offer a service allowing processing of 100.000s of items in seconds, check out https://feedlabs.io for more!


Something is not working as expected, what do I do?

We love feedback! Please send an email to vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl and I will personally help you.


I need a feature which is not implemented, what do I do?

We are currently working very hard implementing many new features. However, if you have some useful suggestions, please send the to me at vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl.

plugins.name: Skeleton Craft – Effortless Skeleton Screens for Loading and Simplified UI
plugins.description:
What is Skeleton Craft?

Skeleton Craft is a Figma plugin designed to help you create skeleton screens from your existing designs, enhancing your workflow efficiency. It supports elements like text (color and corner radius), strokes (color), inputs, images (color), and detaching component instances. Whether you’re working on prototypes, preparing presentations, or creating simplified graphics for marketing and web interfaces, Skeleton Craft provides a straightforward solution for visualizing and iterating on your designs.


Use cases:

  1. Loading screens: Generate skeleton screens to simulate loading states, improving user experience during transitions.
  2. Simplified graphics: Create minimalistic interface graphics for marketing and web purposes, ensuring clarity in your visual communication.


How to use:

  1. Select the elements you want to transform
  2. Customize your skeleton appearance with the color and corner options
  3. Click "Craft Skeleton" and watch your loading states appear instantly
  4. Your original designs remain untouched while skeletons are created alongside


Trial & premium features

  1. 7-day free trial: Try all features completely free for 7 days
  2. After-purchase: Unlimited access to all current and future features
  3. One-time purchase: No subscriptions, just a single payment for lifetime access
plugins.tagline: Turn Designs into Skeletons with One Click, Design tools

  4. Your original designs remain untouched while skeletons are created alongside


Trial & premium features

plugins.name: Figma to LVGL
plugins.description:
Unlock the power of LVGL with our Figma plugin, designed to bridge the gap between design and development. This plugin allows you to export your Figma designs into LVGL-compatible XML, paving the way for seamless integration with the upcoming LVGL Editor.


Plugin modes

Use our plugin in two ways:

  1. As a standalone plugin for quick style exports
  2. In Dev Mode as a CodeGen plugin, seamlessly integrated into your development workflow alongside other code generation tools


Current version

Our initial release focuses on the basics: exporting XML style attributes from your Figma designs. While currently limited in scope, this is just the beginning! In the coming months, we'll be rolling out extensive features that align with the LVGL Editor's development, including full component export, nested structures, and more sophisticated styling options.


About LVGL Editor and XML format

The LVGL Editor is crafted to accelerate the visual development of UIs while maintaining the flexibility of code where it matters most. Our XML format is tailored for developers, offering a declarative approach to UI design that emphasizes component-based thinking.


Key features of the XML format:

  1. Component-based design: Think in components to create modular and reusable UI elements.
  2. Declarative widget description: Define widgets in a clear and structured manner.
  3. Nesting support: Easily nest widgets to build complex interfaces.
  4. Developer-friendly code generation: Produce clean and efficient code that developers can easily work with.
  5. Runtime widget loading: Load widgets dynamically at runtime for flexible UI updates.
  6. Real-time preview: Get instant feedback with a live preview of your components.
  7. Component testing: Test new components to ensure quality and performance.


Not a no-code tool

The Editor is designed for developers who are comfortable with coding. The XML format aids in defining the view and provides a preview for rapid design iterations. While visually intensive parts can be crafted using XML, more complex interactions and logic should be handled through code, leveraging the widget's API and defining callbacks as needed.


Embrace the future of UI development with the LVGL Figma Plugin, where design meets code in perfect harmony.
plugins.tagline: Streamline your LVGL embedded UI development

plugins.name: Art Director Toolkit
plugins.description:
Efficiently crank out designs and decks like a Bawse by automating tedious tasks like grid layouts, item distribution, block layouts, randomizing objects, and text cleanup.


Watch the tutorial videos here for a quick primer on the tools.


Auto Grid Layout Tool:

Crank out mood boards by laying out items in a variety of grid formats:

  • Basic Grid: Equal subdivision based on number of columns
  • Columns: Masonry grid layout based on columns. Column heights are adjusted to fit within margins.
  • Rows: Masonry grid layout based on rows. Row widths are adjusted to fit within margins.
  • Random: Interlocking grid layout. Seeded randomness creates predictable variations.
  • Auto Columns: Intelligently creates a column based grid while maintaining visual order of items.
  • Auto Rows: Intelligently creates a row based grid while maintaining visual order of items.


Distribute Tool:

Intelligently distribute items within the selection bounds with a desired gap. You can choose to have items maintain their size ratios and scale up/down to create the desired spacing. Or they can all resize to have an equal width/height with a desired spacing in between


Blockify Tool:

Blockify your selection with a single click either vertically or horizontally. The tool automatically detects the order of elements. The tool also intelligently scales text to fit the block based on the visual outlines of the text vs white space borders in the text.


Swap Fills:

Quickly swap the fills of two selected elements. If more than two elements are selected, the tool randomly swaps the fills among the selection.


Randomizer:

Add randomness to items based on position, rotation and scale. Set the min and max values for precise control. Seeded randomness creates predictable patterns.


Text Tools:

Text cleanup quickly removes extra spaces from a text block.

Make Single Para will remove any paragraph breaks from the selected text and turn everything into a single paragraph.


Color Hashtags:

Quickly add a desired color to all hashtags within the selected text/text blocks.


Send feature requests, bug reports, and suggestions to artdirectortoolkit@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Automate tedious design and layout tasks.
